website_summaries.verdict: Low price for liquid cooling system that generates less noise than predecessors.
pros: Contains improvements in the design of the fan and the copper cold plate to allow for more efficient cooling
Makes use of a large diameter tubing, which has a low evaporation level and is easier to maneuver into place
Works with multiple sockets for Intel and AMD CPUs
cons: Pump may not last if you're using your computer for heavy-duty work

website_summaries.verdict: The best budget CPU cooling system for smaller or budget PC gaming builds needing liquid cooling.
pros: Central fan fits into a variety of places of most PC gaming cases
Fan runs quietly at most performance levels
Tubing is durable to keep water contained
cons: Updating the controlling software can be difficult since the Corsair website can be buggy

customer_reviews.title: Comes with AMD and I tell bracket amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this bad boy and it took me from running intense games at 65c down to a cool 25-35c max. At first I was scared because I read a lot of review that said that it doesn't come with a AMD bracket but that is false it comes with a amd and intel bracket. Total installation took me about 20-30 mins but that's because I had trouble installing the fan and radiator they are a little tricky to get into place but besides that the whole ordeal was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed no AM4 bracket
customer_reviews.text: The amazon listing says comes with an AM4 socket attachment to mount for ryzen boards... specifically chose this model because it came with it. IT DID NOT ship with any such thing. so now I'm forced to find a bracket from corsair wait a couple more days for a build that should have been done in an hour. Not recommending this product or changing the rating until I can actually use this, until then it's complete junk. Because it can't do the one job I paid for it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a year.
customer_reviews.text: Died 1 year and a little over 1 month from date of purchase (pump not running anymore), probably about 1 year from date of installation. It has a 5 year warranty, but you won't get money back and will likely have to send yours in for repair or replacement (just provided them with proof of purchase, so waiting on RMA to be generated). Cools fine, but you should probably buy 2 if you need your computer daily so you have a backup when one dies because of the downtime with the return process. I had to run to the local store and buy something so I'm $200+ for 1 year of cooling. That being said, it does cool very well.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Poor service process by Corsair
customer_reviews.text: After only a month started making a grinding noise from the pump. Dealing with Corsair means creating an account and sending it back for replacement. No default advanced replacement which seems silly for a vital component like this. I bought a different cooler and will be selling the refurb when I get it back.
customer_reviews.author: ascendr

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit, easy Install in AM4 stock socket mounting
customer_reviews.text: Easy Install with an AMD Ryzen cpu. Mounts to plastic clips like the old Am3+ cpu coolers. Mounting kit included everything for every type cpu. Included long screws go through the fan and into the radiator. Replaced my rear exhaust fan with this fan and radiator in a CoolerMaster N-200 case. Impressed so far. Only dropped my temps about 3 degrees on the Passmark cpu test but I had a nice aftermarket air cooler in there before with extra case fans. This was a training experience for me since I am building a supercomputer for a business next week.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Peel

customer_reviews.title: Sudden leak killed graphics card
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, I was on my PC and out of no where I hear a gurgling spit sound and poof now I have a leaking mess and a dead graphics card. Leak started from the main block and dripped down onto the graphics card. No other damage was done, main board and CPU are fine but my graphics card is now toast... Really pissed that this happened... Will not be buying any further products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Alexia

customer_reviews.title: ... this particular water cooled system is one of the best on the market
customer_reviews.text: I believe this particular water cooled system is one of the best on the market. I like the overall design and quality of the product. It was easy to install with my ryzen thread ripper processor. Ultimately I had to return this product and go with a traditional Fan/Heatsink combo because the fans & water pump were extremely noisy! They were so noisy at night that it sounded like I had crickets in my house. I am not exaggerating when I make this statement! My computer room is on the other end of the house, and I can literally hear the water pump down the hallway. The CPU load on the threadripper was only ~50% to cause this sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Smallberries

customer_reviews.title: Pump Blew Up, Coolant Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Pump blew up and dripped coolant all over my PC, sticking almost everywhere. Worked brilliant for the first 5 months, but then disaster. Nothing but issues with Corsair, my other H100i AIO only runs at 950 RPM (and they want me to pay for the RMA outbound) and two Corsair K70 RGB have been sent through an RMA for a duplicate keypress issue. I've never believed in saying "stay away from X company" but stay away from Corsair, extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Karim Chehab

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself money and buy a regular air cooler
customer_reviews.text: Not great, I used on a i7-7700K (7th gen) and system temps were never stellar, usually 60C or so average under not much load. Thermal paste was applied minimally and evenly. Swapped out to a Noctura and now temps are COLD, under 30C idle and average around 40C. After 4 months I think the pump has died, I'm getting 100C overheat warnings/errors and random reboots. Having to save my work and immediately shutdown. Just guessing pump died. If you think about it....a pump right on the hottest part of the system doesn't seem smart, wish I had known this before purchase. Can't return to Amazon anymore, and don't really need another crappy cooler, so it's a dud to me.
customer_reviews.author: Andre V.

customer_reviews.title: H100i v2 is better.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to compare it to my H100i v2 because this model has a thicker radiator. I tested and compared the two, and in the end the new pump/coldplate in the H100i v2 is much BETTER and keeps temps cooler all around (idle/gaming/rendering/load). Using the same fan setup on both radiators, even at max RPM, I was seeing at least 7-10C higher all around while using the H105. While I like the aesthetics of the H105, the H100i v2 is the better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: It's an overkill water cooler
customer_reviews.text: If I hadn't got it for the sale price I probably would have never bought it. The two fans are overkill and kinda useless. Having the two fans doesnt double the air flow but rather allows the first fan to blow more air through the radiator by a small percent. The thermal paste was a nice touch but after some use it seems to be on the lower end of quality. I did enjoy the easy mounting steps and the hose being a smooth rubber rather than the cheap plastic hose. It is a water cooler though that was easy to install and is still working after 6 months. 7/10
customer_reviews.author: Rueben

customer_reviews.title: H115i they skimped on washers.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing much to add to what has been said by many others other than to confirm a few other reviewers comments : they go cheap on the washers supplying only 8, not the required 16 (4 per fan plus 8 for mounting to case. It's not a big deal but seriously - how cheap can a manufacturer get on a premium product?? And of course you try finding black washers in a hardware store...
customer_reviews.author: Desertsweeper

customer_reviews.title: Effective cooling, easy installation, pretty quiet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cooler to support an overclocked i7-7700k. Very pleased so far. Maintains temperatures in a reasonable range even under heavy load, but it's not obnoxiously loud, either. Instructions were easy to follow and installation of the mounting bracket to the motherboard was easy. The whole process went more quickly than mounting a conventional, fan-based cooler, while leaving a lot more open space in the bargain. I can hear the fan a bit, but it's gentle and quiet without any whine at all. The pump is entirely silent, or at least I can't hear it over any of the other components doing their thing. I'd use this for future builds for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Danilo Campos

customer_reviews.title: Works with 8th gen i7, but you wouldn't know it from the documentation.
customer_reviews.text: With people now buying the LGA 1151 8th gen processors, you need to know this DOES work. The 1151 isn't mentioned in the documentation ( at least yet ), but the key is that on the bottom bracket, you need to move the screw receiver holes inward to accommodate the smaller pattern. This is not mentioned in the instructions and it is not apparent by randomly looking at it that those 4 posts slide in if needed. I had mine boxed up ready to return until I found some comments on this site about that topic. It's a great little unit, they just need to update the documentation.
customer_reviews.author: S. Banas

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Once you've used a liquid cooler, it's hard to fathom ever using a fan/heatsink. I've used this in two other computers along with it's smaller version, H50, on others. This time, I found a problem finding a case to accommodate it along with the MSI X370 Gaming Pro Carbon mobo. It took a full sized case, Corsair 780T, because the two products overlapped in a way that made installation of this liquid cooler impossible on a midtower case.
customer_reviews.author: Dr C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great..
customer_reviews.text: Owned this previously. Haved owned numerous corsair products, throughout the years. Never had a problem, until now. Bought this from another site, failed within 6 months... ok open up a RMA ticket... wait... Nothing. Ordered the same part to go with what i had, same plat through amazon etc. Works great... just do not expect anything if it fails.
customer_reviews.author: Klink

customer_reviews.title: Whisper quiet and install is incredibly simple
customer_reviews.text: Install of this unit is super simple: it comes with coolant prefilled and thermal paste pre-applied so all it takes to get it setup is 12 screws and three 4-pin connectors. After using a computer with a massive fin fan cooler for years I am very happy I went with this liquid cooling unit. I just did a full build of a new computer using this cooler and even with a superclocked gtx 1060 my computer is whisper quiet. I also have had no overheating issues at all using a 4ghz quad core processor (i3 8350k) that gets pegged at 100% for extended periods of time during gaming. Install is really really
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome performing and looking cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome performing and looking cooler (reviews are everyone online about these). One minor thing of note, I set mine up in a single fan push setup, which actually didn't hurt cooling performance, however in order to do this I had to order a additional "Corsair Hydro Screw Kit" from Corsair, as the screws that come with it only give the option for dual fan setup (unless you want inch long screws sticking out the back/top of your case).
customer_reviews.author: Cory Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Could be good, but it has flaws
customer_reviews.text: I've used Corsair before and while their customer service is garbage, their products are usually pretty good. This one is an exception. The headers that connect the fan to the pump do not work. This is a huge problem for anyone who does not have any more headers on their motherboard. It seems I'm not the only one with this issue either as others have mentioned the problem. I am extremely dissapointed in this water cooler and don't think I'll be buying Corsair again. I recommend others stay away as well unless they enjoy gambling. Overall it's an attractive cooler and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Tierney11290

customer_reviews.title: This thing works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to install into a Cooler Master Elite 120. After a bit of case modding, it's in there and BOY does it work. My CPU was idling at around 40C and had, at one point before I shut it down, peaked at over 80C under heavy load. After installing this cooler the CPU idles around 32C and hasn't gotten above 48C during the exact some heavy load. I'm running a Gigabyte Z77N mobo with a i5 3570k @ 3.4Ghz Pros: It works! Reasonably easy to install, even on a MicroATX board Cons: The included fan has a VERY short power cord. I had to use another 120mm fan I had on hand.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Sugg

customer_reviews.title: ... stock components and so far everything is working just fine. The install took some time since this is ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this AIO with all stock components and so far everything is working just fine. The install took some time since this is my first liquid cooling system but even after moving the radiator around in the upper part of my case, no leaks and once everything was finally bolted down, it worked as advertised. My Intel i7-7700k OC'd to 4.8gHz runs at idle in the low 40's C and tops out under stress in the mid 70's C. The fans are quiet and the system so far is working just fine. I may replace the original thermal paste with Arctic MX4 sometime down the road but for now there is no reason to do so.
customer_reviews.author: rcfalcon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cool as well as Lepa
customer_reviews.text: While this cooler works, and does it's job, there are better choices out there. I've done a bit of testing between this unit, and the same size Lepa unit..... the Lepa 120mm liquid cooler easily out performs this one. While there were no "show stopping" issues with this coarsair cooler, there are cheaper options out there that provide better cooling. The biggest highlight of this cooler is the number of mounts that is comes with, and in particular it has a very simply, easy to install AM4 mount, where as the Lepa does not...Lepa requires that you email them a receipt for an AM4 CPU, and then will send you an AM4 mount for their unit.
customer_reviews.author: EdCaffreyMS

customer_reviews.title: Good Liquid Cooling Kit
customer_reviews.text: I heard from around the web that this was a good starter liquid cooling kit and I agree. Pros: Quiet Pretty cheap Effective: Even under load my temps never went above 70 degrees C. Simple to Install Flexible: Many mounting options. Cons: Big radiator: Make sure your case can fit it! Other thoughts: I've heard some debate as to whether the fans should be intake or exhaust. Personally I have mine as exhaust fans and the setup works fine. I haven't tried them as intakes but apparently the fan direction doesn't affect performance meaningfully.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and cool
customer_reviews.text: Only way to go. I had one of these for about 5 years and the fans started getting slow, so I replaced the whole thing. Upon inspection of the old one after the swap, I realzed that the fans were the only real issue.. so I kept the unit and ditched the fans, will use in another build. I was able to sandwich 2 fans around the radiator for a little extra umph - it doesn't need it probably but why not. I run a well cable managed Corsair case with 8 total fans 2F, 2T, 2S, and the 2R fans wrapped around this guy. Nice and cool.
customer_reviews.author: Grib

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Long story short my old cooler went out. I noticed my pc really lagging so I looked at the temps, and I was getting 80C in idle and high 90's when working just a little. I replaced my old liquid cooler with the H60. I'm now getting idle temps around 30C, and stress test maxing out around 50C. It works, and works well. That's all there is to it. One thing I really liked is that it came with the paste already applied, so I didn't have to mess with that. It took me about 1/2 hour total to swamp out the old cooler for the H60.
customer_reviews.author: infamous jt

customer_reviews.title: Disasterous for  liquid  cooler to split  a  gut  and spray goo over  new PC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Cosair Hydro series H115i cooler for my grandson Jun 2017, upon initial start up the unit did not connect with its own software and never worked properly. Then the cooler split a gut and has wrecked other parts in the brand new PC build. We are waiting for Corsair to "Test" our equipment before resolving the damage replacement issue. This is weeks later and the time delay is stressful. We are hoping for a positive conclusion, as our new PC has been unuseable for weeks now. Oct 22, 2017.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence becksted

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with this product
customer_reviews.text: Let me say first that I was very worried that this product would not fit my rig. I have a mini-itx system crammed into a SilverStone SG13B-Q case. I also am running a full-size atx power supply and a 3.5" hard drive. Basically, everything is CRAMMED into this case. I was also worried that I might spring a leak trying to contort the cooling lines to actually fit. I am blown away at the durability of the product. Not only did it fit, but it pushed my core temp of my CPU down by nearly 30 degrees Celsius under full load. That is a HUGE improvement. Couldn't be happier with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Works really well. Mounting another issue.
customer_reviews.text: This works really well on Ryzen. The reason for the 4 stars and not 5 is because of the mounting of the fans. For the NZXT S340 case you need to mount with the included fans in the front with a push configuration. The issue is that if you have the nice LED ML140 fans you can't mount it. The ML140 fan mount holes are dramatically different from the mount holes on the SP140 included fans. So now I'm left with two nice ML fans that couldn't be used. The reason I put this issue in this review is because it affected the mounting of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Reichard Könige

customer_reviews.title: games like BF1 and Overwatch which is gpu intensive never go ...
customer_reviews.text: This cooler will help you with temps for your cpu. Even with a little bit of overclocking. The cooler was bought for a GPU used for mining, the card can reach ridiculous amounts of heat while mining. The card is not mining now because of an issue with the mining application. How ever when gaming, the card now reaches up to 20 c degrees less. games like BF1 and Overwatch which is gpu intensive never go over 70c. Impressive when your gpu some times would reach 90c ! If I want to over clock the card (lightly with decent temps as well.)
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Arrieta

customer_reviews.title: Giving this 4 stars because the documentation is pure garbage. It was not made very clear that the ...
customer_reviews.text: Giving this 4 stars because the documentation is pure garbage. It was not made very clear that the radiator fans hook up to the pump — obvious now, but not while installing it — and it doesn’t mention the sata power cable. I can only imagine their are a few people who ignore that and fry their cpu. (It has been over 4 years since I last built a PC and the power connectors were different back then.) However, if and when you install it correctly it works great. Very quiet and does a good job of keeping the cpu cool.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J. Parrish

customer_reviews.title: H115i
customer_reviews.text: Got this all installed on my board in a new case. Great build quality and extremely easy to get installed. I don't use the software, so I'm having my MOBO run all the fans but there's no issue with that. Temps dropped a decent amount coming off an old Hyper 212+. Looks wonderful in Corsair Carbide 540. Only complaint I have is that my logos are upside down. Flipping it would make the lines kink so I didn't want to do that. If Corsair sold the changeable logo plates on it I would buy them in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Your CPU will thank you
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a rendering computer running a i7-870, could not be any happier! Upgraded from older non stock fan heat sink after small tweaks- reapply thermal compound and resetting numerous times. Was still getting load temps way over the max 73c (90c with prime 95!) all the way down to 45c *max* load temp (prime 95 included) with 20c idle temps. Only "negative" is having to remove the motherboard so you can install the back plate (for most chipsets). Not the biggest deal, but does add more time to installation.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B Beutelspacher II

customer_reviews.title: Bad warranty experience.
customer_reviews.text: Ran fine for a couple months on the bench, but one of the right angle connections broke off when first installing into the case. Corsair accepted the warranty but wouldn't accept payment. ~1 hour on the phone over 3 hours and they had no idea how to accept payment so they could send me a replacement before receiving the the defective product. It's a work computer which can't be down for the 5-7 business days it would take to do a normal RMA, so I had to buy a replacement which I won't be reimbursed for. Not a good experience. Hopefully the replacement won't break too...
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Never bother with heatsinks and fans again
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to install I kicked myself for not having done it sooner. Not only does this install more easily than honking big heatsinks and fans, but it cools better and presents very little surface area for dust. Now, I'll never have to open my PC case and blow dust bunnies out of heatsink fins again. If you care about your PC, you owe it to yourself to purchase this. Trust me, a little old lady can install this.
customer_reviews.author: Rainys A. Blekaitis

customer_reviews.title: great idea.. but had 2 and only lasted 3 yrs
customer_reviews.text: So i i had one in my sons system that went out 3 years then mine this month.. 3 years to the month.. both had same issues pump failure and overheating.. done spending 160+ on a cooler to only fail.. bought the Noctua NH-D15S and never seen my temps so low and awesome.. 2 and out exact same time frame.. seems like intentional failed.. unfortunately i like corsair products but this has me thinking twice ...
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Overclocking my Ryzen 1700 to 4. 0 with consistent ...
customer_reviews.text: Overclocking my Ryzen 1700 to 4.0 with consistent low temperatures, without using extra paste (this comes with pre-applied thermal paste). Installation was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Jaja

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler, although much bigger than it looks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with i7-6700k processor, ASRock motherboard, 32GB memory. At first I felt something like off balance and shaking. I thought for sure i'd just have to deal with the issue. I opened my PC back up to add an additional hdd and upon putting back together, realized one of my case fans was missing a fin and therefore my off balance went away after replacing. Very happy with this, keeps CPU cool The size of this is extremely large though, I wasn't sure if it would fit in full tower case - but it did
customer_reviews.author: 2k3Mach1

customer_reviews.title: High quality, works great, no problems overheating
customer_reviews.text: I've been upgrading my computer with several new components recently. It runs a lot faster and better now, however, a couple weeks after all the upgrades, I found that it was overheating. I purchased one of these coolers, and I'm really happy with the performance. I haven't had any issues with overheating, or even coming close, since I replaced my stock cooler and other fans with these. I put two 120mm fans in as well to be sure I wouldn't run into any issues. I didn't want to risk it after completely rebuilding my computer. It was really easy to replace & install, and I would highly recommend this cooler. It's of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: BRoti

customer_reviews.title: AMD users beware. This unit will be difficult to install.
customer_reviews.text: This was the most difficult unit to install on a AMD processor. So difficult that I damaged my CPU in the process. What made it difficult is the hose. The hose is really stiff which makes it hard to position the pump. If you are planning on buying this follow the directions backwards. The directions will tell you to attacj the fan and radiator to the case first then attach the pump to the CPU. Don't do that because it will make the installation harder. Instead install the pump on the CPU first and then attach the fan and radiator to the case.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Died in 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought in April 2018, died in December. Not worth the money. There is other brands out there, give those a try. I noticed my computer slowing to single digit frames per second on ALL games. Opening web pages and watching streaming video services was painfully slow. Checked all components but my cpu was running 85-95 Celsius. Random reboots and crashes under any load. Checked radiator, ice cold. Pump is no longer pumping. Tried other fan connections (CPU, System Fan 01, 02, 03, etc...). None worked for pump but fans work on all connections. Last PC crash killed my OS install. Have to spend hours reloading software. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler with loud fans
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a lot better than stock cooler heatsink/fans provided by Intel. Install: Easy installation took a total of about 20 minutes, took a while to do the push/pull config, but that's more personal issue lol. Pros: Temps way down!. Can get Corsair link to set the Corsair logo with RGB Settings. Cons: USB port for corsair link adds an ugly looking cable in the way from the motherboard to the pump. Stock fans are loud at full speed! They move air but are way too loud for my liking.
customer_reviews.author: natprapa panayrat

customer_reviews.title: Done with Corsair products
customer_reviews.text: The h115i worked for a year and a half then it died. One hose is hot and the other is NOT, which is the classic sign of a dead pump. I sent a support ticket to Corsair a week ago and I have not heard back from them. Customer support is garbage. If I want an AIO cooler then I'll get an EVGA. Corsair finally responded to my email and after a few exchanges they agreed to an RMA. On the bright side they sent out a brand new H115i Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Another Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loud cheap garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so loud. I've tried everything to try and move the air bubbles to stop it from making so much noise. The fans seem awful and they might be the cause of the random racket. I just don't know with this thing. I suppose it does its job it terms of cooling but at a serious penalty. I've tried to give it plenty of time but I cannot recommend this cooler the way it is. To make matters worse the driver to control the fan speed profiles is completely proprietary. Given a second chance I wouldn't purchase this cooler given their competition.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: No AM4 bracket included.
customer_reviews.text: Should have said from the start that the AM4 bracket wasn't included in the box. I could have bought it and finished building my computer but no, I have to wait several days and pay extra for an AM4 bracket that should have been included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cost Performance Value and Lasts for years!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these many YEARS ago when they first came out for an AMD/Asus over clocked build and its still running today without issue! I recently purchased another for a NAS/Media Server build and just like the last one it works without issue and I expect it will run for years just as the last one has and still is. I occasionally have to blow dust out of the radiator but that it. This is an outstanding value and cost less than many heat sink fan coolers. The build quality of the units I've received has been very good. I see no down side to this cooler if you have the space.
customer_reviews.author: AKM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality computer temperature drops as much i expect
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality computer temperature drops as much i expect, even from 80 degrees to 60 on overclocking work for video games. The only problem was the sockets are not compatible for some motherboards i manage to find one for the 775 intel socket this one give a lot of problems. Also the radiator hold too much dust in a short time it's normal on the conditions you are but annoying for the constant cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Best CPU cooler
customer_reviews.text: I've installed several different models of the Corsair Hydro Series on different machines. This compares to the H60, but it's much, much better, definitely worth the couple of extra bucks. The installation was easier, the components are better and easier to put together, and it has two exhaust fans, one in front of the radiator and one behind it. The installation makes a nicely snug fit over the processor. The processor (an i7-4790K, not overclocked at the moment) which was running over 100 degrees Celsius under stress, is now running at 65 degrees Celsius under stress. Buy this CPU cooler. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: TanMan

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty surprised at how well this is cooling my Ryzen ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty surprised at how well this is cooling my Ryzen 1700x. I haven't overclocked yet due to a temp reading issue with the Ryzen chips but so far everything is running as cool as it can. Even at 100% load my fan speed barely breaks 60% and the temps read 63c which may or may not be correct. Once I trust the temp readings I'll see how well it handles an overclock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to cool really well otherwise and is mostly quiet other than ...
customer_reviews.text: Fan has started to fail after only a few weeks of ownership. I will contact the company if they don't contact me first. Seems to cool really well otherwise and is mostly quiet other than the fan. 7700k @ 4.8 stock voltage and this is only mildly warm.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Mohn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent AIO! Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: The H110i is a great AIO radiator for my first liquid cooler. It was very easy to install and it has both cooler brackets for AMD and Intel CPUs. The manual is pretty straightforward and comes with pre-applied thermal paste on the copper plate. It would be nice if theres a small thermal paste tube in case you put the cooler upside down and messed up the paste, but it still keeps my cpu cool at 35-40 degrees Celsius while gaming. I highly recommend Corsair AIO’s for both beginner and expert PC builders.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail A.

customer_reviews.title: Over 2 years and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I have now had this in my current PC for 25 months, and it still works great! I'm very happy with my purchase - it's been keeping my i5 6600K running at a cool and stable 4.5GHz the whole time, with no issues. It's quiet enough and doesn't leak, so for the price I'd say it can't be beat! Only thing you should be aware of is that the tubing is fairly stiff and not incredibly long, so make sure you have somewhere near the CPU to mount the radiator. Not much else to say, it's pretty straightforward! Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Kelso

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and it Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet, keeps my i7 CPU cool at around 30-degrees (C). Much quieter than my old CoolerMaster Seidon with a longer warranty (twice as long as the CoolerMaster) which I had to replace. My only complaint is the instructions are a bit vague about which standoffs to use - it was difficult to discern which one to use, but trial and error will tell you. It comes with the CPU paste already applied which is nice. Also, the H60 version does not light up in case you were wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Kaorisdad

customer_reviews.title: Small cooler for tight spaces or tight budgets.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for a while now, there is an updated version of it that is very similar. For a small 120 radiator it works very well. I currently have it installed in a MATX Styx Classic case on a Ryzen 5 2600 running at 4GHz and it keeps the CPU around 58°C while gaming. Linpack stress testing the temps go to around 75°C. The stock cooler would run up to 95°C and the PC would shut down.
customer_reviews.author: R Russ

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Mine!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is sitting in my Corsair Carbide 400C Compact Mid-Tower Case on an ASUS Z270 M1 Motherboard with an Intel i7 7700K CPU, ASUS GeForce 1080GTX Turbo GPU, Corsair HX850i PSU, 4 Corsair SP-120 fans, and an ADATA SU800 512gb SSD running Windows 10 Pro 64-bit. This unit is a little bulky and almost made it where I couldn't install the RAM inside the Corsair Carbide 400C Compact Mid-Tower. The fans that come with it are alright, but I recommend replacing them with SP-120's.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan H. Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with instructions manual
customer_reviews.text: Fans are amazingly quiet, CPU temps with below specs give ~30-34c idle. 46-55 under load. Very pleased with instructions manual, ease of installation and quality of materials. Hopefully it never bursts or anything crazy. Used in a newly built computer with: Case: Fractal Design R5 CPU: Intel i5 4790k w/ Corsair H105 liquid cooler Ram: G.SKILL 16 GB DDR3 1600 GPU: EVGA GTX 970 SC ACX 2.0 Drive: Samsung 850 EVO 512 GB SSD MB: MSI H97M-G43 mini ATX Monitor:ASUS 24" 144 Hz 1080p Bose On-Ear sound link bluetooth headset StarWars Battlefront 2015 All Ultra MFAA 1080p (70-90 FPS)
customer_reviews.author: rafia

customer_reviews.title: AMD Won't be burning my house down
customer_reviews.text: I have an AMD FX-9370 installed and with the stock cooler (air) it sat at idle at ~66C, not bad, no smoke and house isn't burning down...Ran cinebench and it got up to 91C please note this processor is 220W and 8 cores. I installed this (you can't really blame me I don't wanna burn the house down) and it sat at idle at the cool temp of 40C and when I ran cinebench is heated up to 50C. At idle the liquid cool improved temps by 65% and when under load by an 82% decrease, so about a 74% decrease in CPU temps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs refinement
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Does its job very well, an i5-6600K stays at 33C idle, 36C under load (15 mins of running HeavyLoad on Windows). Easy to install. Cons: The installation instructions have not been updated in ages and do not mention compatibility with LGA 1151 at all. LGA 2011 standoffs must be used when installing the pump on an LGA 1151 motherboard. The radiator/fan mounting screws have rounded heads that do not sit flush with the case frame. The main drawback is that the pump makes a loud cavitation sound.
customer_reviews.author: HockeyFinn32768

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy one!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and pump wasn't working. I called and am waiting to rma it. Decided I was going to buy a h100iv2 to tide me over until claim was done with corsair so I could get my build completed. Needless to say I should of bought another brand the h100iv2 blew up soaking the psu and other components. Stay away from corsair water coolers!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: spencer n.

customer_reviews.title: Temps are pretty consistent even with the hot temperatures of the 7700k
customer_reviews.text: so far this has been a solid cooler for the money. I have this installed on my i7 7700k. Temps are pretty consistent even with the hot temperatures of the 7700k. -minimal noise from the large cooler unless you set the fans above 75%. -the optional software is easy to use and functions easily. - I love the look of the water cooler in my case. The LED on the pump gives it a little something extra but isn't over the top. -easily installed.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: I love when I make a good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old Antec Kuhler CPU cooler( started to make clicking noises and when I noticed my gaming rig start to get super sluggish so after running a test found out my overclocked CPU was running at 98 degrees! Realizing that the old cooler wasn't doing the job anymore I looked around and decided to go with this Corsair H75. My old cooler took a little more effort than I anticipated to remove but after some finessing this CPU cooler was very easy to install. Booted up and my rig is running some of the latest games (Batman: Arkham Knight, etc.) at a cool 45 degrees. System is lightning fast now! Will update if anything else comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Don;t expect great things from this closed water cooling unit
customer_reviews.text: didn't lower the temps on my CPU as much as i thought it would and I cannot knowingly advise anyone to buy this water cooling solution without warning you that this is not suitable for overclocking. You will have better temps with the hyper 212 than you will with this unit. If you plan on using any closed water cooling loop and overclocking anything please look at Corsairs H100i water cooling solution as it will yield better temps and is suitable for overclocking. This unit simply cannot keep your CPU cool
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: The upper drive bay became useless in the process
customer_reviews.text: While the cooler was a bit of a pain to install in my Corsair 450D case, I realize it's because the fan and cooler needed to be installed BEFORE everything else. The upper drive bay became useless in the process. The result? Amazing cooling performance. My past coolers on average kept the CPU around 37-43c at idle, which is at least 10-15c above ambient (27c). This cooler with the fans running low kept my stock i7-6700k no more than 2c above ambient. When the fans ramp up it's definitely audible, but some time will be spent monitoring the temperatures while optimizing the fan profile to keep it quiet during casual use.
customer_reviews.author: Phuong Ta

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, but not silent.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars, but so far a little noise comes from the pump making it impossible for my PC to get to the level of silent I would like. I am extremely pleased with the performance though. I paired this with an NZXT kraken G10 bracket and watercooled my gpu. I am getting 43C on max load. I have an MSI GTX 1080 Duke. I will try to keep messing with pump speed to get silence. If I find it is not the coolers fault, I will change to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended....
customer_reviews.text: I installed this fan 3 years ago in my Corsair Carbide A540 case. This cooler maintains moderately low CPU temps even under full load. The radiator fans were too loud for my tastes. I replaced them with noctura fans and I couldn't be happier. No problems with this cooler at all. Keep your case clean along with the fans and you should not have any problem with this cooler. Also Corsair uses iCue software(i think I got the name right) to monitor all their computer hardware as well as update firmware etc.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best AIO!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Make sure you have a big enough case for it though and the proper mounts. Overall it works wonderfully and is a must if you're overclocking your CPU. Even more so if you have one of the recent Intel chips. They run pretty hot, but the H115i keeps things running nice and cool and does it pretty quickly too.
customer_reviews.author: Matt F.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and effective.
customer_reviews.text: I've installed 4 or 5 of these now. My oldest one is still functioning, in use since 2012. I did notice minor performance degradation as I'm sure the fluid degrades over time, probably coagulates in the heat sink and slowly evaporates thru the tubing.... Seeing maybe a 5-10% loss in 5 years. I'd say that's pretty incredible durability for such a small, affordable system. Keeps my 3770k OC at 4.5 GHz cooled to 60C at full load. Can't really go wrong with one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Kowalewski

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooler back in December of 2016. Installation was pretty straightforward, and up until recently the cooler was working just fine. Within the last few days, though, the cooler's pump stopped working entirely. This is the second corsair cooler I've purchased to die within the first year of use. I've checked around online, and apparently Corsair's coolers are known for having significant pump problems. I won't be coming back to Corsair for parts again. They don't seem to care much about the longevity of their devices.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend This WaterCooler!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is fantastic, its functions great and cools as expected with a 280mm radiator. The stock fans are a bit loud. I replaced them though with the Thermaltake RGB 14 140mm fans because I wanted the RGB fans all through my case. It cools even better and looks cool too. Disclaimer: If using AMD CPUS, the Corsair Link software may not be your best bet for CPU temp. Recommend using a software you trust or directly from AMD or MOBO maker.
customer_reviews.author: Dusten Grant

customer_reviews.title: good but not great
customer_reviews.text: it shouldn't cost as much as it does...it works fine and installation was very easy for amd cpu. the fan that came with it started making noise in less than a week but i put different fans on it and it works. temps didn't really drop much from a standard air cooler but it does look nice and it doesn't leak. i can't say i would buy it again but it is cheaper than buying a whole liquid cooling system. maybe $12 cheaper and i would give it 5 stars but i did expect more from corsair.
customer_reviews.author: twylyte

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty cool to me
customer_reviews.text: Never used a water pump before. This is pretty cool to me, keeps my Amd FD9590FHHKWOF Fx-9590 which is both AMD and apparently a notorious cpu for heat issues at 60 Celsius (+/- 5 degrees). Scared me at first because I had an air bubble in it, but once I just laid it down to get the air out I'm all set. Kicks ass, just wish my fans worked a bit better, they seem to have less air flow than my fans, but it isn't causing any heat issues even with extended use (12 hrs)
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: This was incredibly easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Was going to just re-do the thermal grease on the processor and decided to try a water cooled heat sink. This was incredibly easy to install. Dropped the CPU temp about 80 degrees. This is without a doubt the way to go. The seller did a great job shipping and getting the product to me as well. Packaging is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: BarryC

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for my PC
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I use to think it was my graphics card fan causing all the racket when I fired up a game. Nope it was the CPU fan. With this, I hardly notice a difference when gaming as far as fan sound goes. It cools way better than heat sink. I would get 40-60 fps on a good day before. Now, barring other factors, I get mostly 90-100. This is my first liquid cooling system so I don't have anything to compare it to. I should have gone liquid years ago.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Making noise after few years
customer_reviews.text: I've got this cooler couple years ago and recently it started to make pretty noticeable noise, very annoying because it sounds exactly like swapping HDD which I hate because my SSD is very fast and I have plenty of RAM, I guess it returns me the old pains from the dark days of spinning disks.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel Px

customer_reviews.title: Sounds worse than an air cooler
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened with Corsair but their lower line of products makes weird buzzing and gurgling noises all the time. I hear it's a widespread issue with air in the pumps. And returning it might not really help. I'm going to return mine and see if I can get one that works for me. The cooling? I guess it's fine but the higher-priced coolers do that better as well. For reference, the higher series coolers sound fine. Don't get the H60 or H75.
customer_reviews.author: Aviv M

customer_reviews.title: super simple and clean looking cooler
customer_reviews.text: super simple and clean looking cooler. Installed ( very easily) as an intake, which is recommended, and the tubes were plenty long enough to reach the front of the case on a mid tower where I prefer to place intakes. Runs on a i5 6600k at 4.2 ghz and it sits right around 27C. haven't managed to get it above 68C under full load. Happy with the product especially when considering the price. This was 3 dollars more when I bought it than the ever present huge block fan style cooler that I really dislike aesthetically.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Super Build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Super build quality, cool monitor apps, nice LED color, easy installation. This keeps my overclocked I7700K running at 39d C tops. Will buy again to build another PC.
customer_reviews.author: Ira Carmel

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not recommended for AMD Threadripper
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my CPU cool enough, but because of the round mating surface (as opposed to a square one), it does not completely cover my Threadripper CPU. I have fans on BOTH the front and back pushing air in from the front and pulling it from the back. This uses all my available fans and increases air flow. Needs to be cleaned periodically, more frequently in a high-dust environment.
customer_reviews.author: Willam H.

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I recently did a partial upgrade and this is my first time venturing into any type of water cooling. The system couldn't be more seamless I don't think. It was very easy to put together, I did have to do some rigging to get it in my case properly but the cooling power is amazing. Better than my previous cooling unit I wish they had included some instructions on testing it before putting it all together so you can make sure it doesn't have any leaks, otherwise it's a solid cooling option.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: is pretty quiet until the SP120 fan ramps to full tilt
customer_reviews.text: About as basic of an AIO as you can get. It keeps temps down, is pretty quiet until the SP120 fan ramps to full tilt, and lets you move where the heat should go in your case. Four stars because the mounting brackets are...not the best. They'll bend out of shape if you get a little too torque happy with your screwdriver, but hey, anything will given enough pressure. The magnetic retaining is nice, but the pump block is big. Not quite H80i GT big, but it's got size to it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Arrendale

customer_reviews.title: The pump has longevity issues.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in January and the unit started making noise a few weeks ago. Today, my CPU automatically rises to 90C and it seems as though the pump has failed. Will submit for RMA, but can't say I'd recommend this unit based on the number of pump failures I've seen while looking up this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Finger

customer_reviews.title: Entry Level Water-cooling has never been easier!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy install. (The backplate will be loose behind the Mobo durring most of the installation until you install the thumb screws, this had me wondering if I did it right until that point.It was tight afterward) My temps at Idle are 28-32c My Temps at Load are 46-52c Thats running demanding games like Witcher 3 with mods, Fallout 4 with 200+ mods, PUBG on Ultra for 6 hours. Huge improvement over my Hyper 212 Evo.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Van Liew

customer_reviews.title: Kind of confused about this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mini tower, but it doesn't keep the cpu cool enough to the temps i like. It is also very big and probably was not ment to be fit into a mini tower. It works ok, just maybe not for my needs. Its not as powerful as i was hoping for especially it being a water cooler. This is my first water cooler so i am not sure what to expect, but did i get a defective one, or underpowered?
customer_reviews.author: yar Law

customer_reviews.title: Liquid cooled added 1GHz
customer_reviews.text: Used this with my i5-4960k Intel CPU. This CPU comes set @ 3.5 GHz and with this water cooled setup i was able to get it to overclock @4.5 GHz stable. Huge jump in overall performance!!! NOTE: If you are going to use this on a intel CPU you will need access to the back of the motherboard to install a piece. It may be a hassle to get to or you may have to remove your motherboard to install the needed part. Just know it may take some time to get this installed. Must have for overclocking!
customer_reviews.author: Woohoo Review It!

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 10months - then broke!
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to install, setup and it kept the cpu very cool. Virtually zero noise. 10 months later the pump broke while the fans are roaring trying to call down the pc. It seems this is very common for Corsair products so be careful as not all of them last.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler, Loud Stock Fans
customer_reviews.text: I've had this cooler for more than a month now. No regrets with the purchase. I have it installed on my Ryzen 7 1800X, overclocked to 4.0ghz. Idle temps hover around 35 degrees C and around 66 degrees C under 100% load. I did have to remove the loud stock fans though. The two included fans get really loud under heavy load. I just kept the fans off and just used the two 200mm fans on the top of my case. Installation was a breeze though, but only because I had help with the handling and installation of the radiator.
customer_reviews.author: Panda Bear

customer_reviews.title: My CPU went from 42 Celsius at idle to 26 ...
customer_reviews.text: My CPU went from 42 Celsius at idle to 26 Celsius. I am in central FL and keep my room about 78 which is what the CPU is running at. I am not a hard core gamer. I run VM, SQL and do development on my machine so at compile and heavy SQL times I can run it quite hard and lately it has been overheating and with the stock cooler on my FX 8350 CPU. Should have went liquid cooled years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Best AIO for you dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Dont settle for imitations like I did. Those "Thermal" types are no good compared to Corsair. Instead of using a cheap 22mm radiator, this one is 38mm thick... allowing for lots of cooling and higher overclocking. I installed Delta 200cfm fans on the radiator for more pressure, although the provided fans would satisfy most users as their outputs are a good 80cfm. I know for a fact I am running 10C cooler than the copycat brand was able to do. Corsair, I am a new fan or your AIOs. But I still am not a fan of your cases.
customer_reviews.author: UZP Customs Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Cooler than me.
customer_reviews.text: This liquid cooler comes pre-charged, and works great. I can't update the drivers for it, but it still works without fail and i run my computer all day and all night sometimes for several days in a row. This is definitely a great choice. Make sure you use low profile ram however as the size might affect the positioning of everything inside the chassis. Definitely Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Atlas L.

customer_reviews.title: Took off the pre-applied thermal paste and added Arctic MX-4 ...
customer_reviews.text: Took off the pre-applied thermal paste and added Arctic MX-4 and have had no heat issues with CPU, can't even feel heat coming from the radiator. Took a minute to Install because there are 2 types of standoffs possibly needed for AMD CPUs, depending on how the motherboard is laid out, however the instructions only mention using one set.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Schroen

customer_reviews.title: About the best out of the box water cooler I've seen.
customer_reviews.text: If my computer got any colder, I'd be afraid of condensation forming. Seriously, it is that good. My i7-6800k CPU under full load rarely pushes 40 C and base load I am near room temperature (24 C). Even under full load playing games like Fallout 4 on max resolution, can barely hear the fans kick in. A good thermal paste is essential however (see my review for Phobya HeGrease Extreme). Had other Corsair water cooled systems but this one is the best by far. Unless you plan to spend serious dollars on a custom built water cooled system, this is the best option in my book.
customer_reviews.author: JBeckley

customer_reviews.title: Good, but can be better
customer_reviews.text: Used on an AMD Athlon X4 860K Before water cooling, I was hitting almost 100c on stock cooler, I would have to open the case and turn on a fan to blow on the MB just to get it to go 85c. After getting this, at worst, it might have touched 90c(I had to turn on my external fan to blow more at the radiator). But after replacing the fan it came with using a Corsair ML120, It rarely touches 75c(again worst case, it idles around 60c), and that's without the external fan. Will plan to install a 2nd ML120 fan behind the radiator soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kei

customer_reviews.title: H115i Killing the game.... was concerned ...
customer_reviews.text: H115i Killing the game.... was concerned about the back plate being loose before pump installation... no worries it tightens up once the pump is installed temps with the 240mm that I upgraded from stayed around 27/28 idle and around 42/44 after an hour of playing bf1 ultra settings on a 6600k with a standard oc of 4.1 after switching to H115i idle temps hover around 22/24 and sit steady at 37/38 after an hour of bf1 same settings
customer_reviews.author: HustleCraft

customer_reviews.title: Kicks the daylights out of air.
customer_reviews.text: This thing cools a 4790k in an itx case with bad airflow. It's amazing. I tried 3 high end air coolers before giving in and trying the AIO. (CPU would throttle on the air coolers) now it runs perfectly. No throttling, no heat problems. I guess technically the fan isn't the quietest considering it's pressure and airflow, but it's not too bad. My h100i on my other computer is able to run a bit quieter, but that's what a bigger radiator does for you. (and that wouldn't fit in that case anyway)
customer_reviews.author: Sean Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Ice cold... literally
customer_reviews.text: It dissipates quite a bit of heat. I bought a bunch of extra fans and set them all as intake, then put the Corsair fan as output (in pull configuration) so that there's positive pressure inside my case, and all the air in the case blows out through the radiator (rad). When I put my hand against the outlet, there's a good amount of heat so I know it's working. I have yet to see my system go over 100oF. One day in December when the room was about 65oF, the temperature monitor said 0oC (32oF). My CPU was literally freezing inside. Way awesome.
customer_reviews.author: leno2002

customer_reviews.title: Stays cool even when operating in quiet mode
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on coolers and landed on this one. Stays cool even when operating in quiet mode, high performance mode is pretty loud, but I haven't needed to run it even under load. There were more cables to route than I thought there'd be but I managed to hide them pretty well. I'm very pleased with this cooler. If you're going closed loop and you don't care about a bunch of rgb fans, go with the hydro. Very solid cooler
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: keeps thing nice and cool. there are less noisy fans on the market.
customer_reviews.text: i5-2500k dropped about -20c because of this aio. was coming from asetek 120mm radiator in push pull config. I decided I'm going to push the i5-2500k to its breaking point, or at least until I get bsod because windows is telling me I'm literally melting fps and using 110% of cpu utilization with my overclock. I'm not upgrading to anything newer than sandy bridge until I see huge improvements. so, this is certainly the cooler for my intended uses.
customer_reviews.author: totalchaos5320

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: After installation there was a strange sound like marbles which I thought was coming from the pump. After using a stethoscope the noise was not coming from the pump but one of the Corsair fans. Fortunately I had 4 high static pressure fans which I installed in push pull and now it is quiet as can be. By using 4 fans in a push pull arrangement it drop the temperature by almost 5°. A suggestion would be for Corsair to supply a wiring harness that would allow adaptation for 4 fans.
customer_reviews.author: art100

customer_reviews.title: It's nice. I got it on sale
customer_reviews.text: It's nice. I got it on sale. Keeps my CPU (i7-7700k) between 34°C -45-°C with normal use. Browsing the web, playing music, Discord, Steam, and some other client running in the background all at once. My friend has the one with the bigger radiator and two fans and it keeps his around 25°C if I remember correctly.
customer_reviews.author: adan

customer_reviews.title: customer service was good and fair
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one to replace the same one that failed and ruined a high end video board. Corsair sent me a replacement and paid fair market price for the video board. Other than the fact that my system was down for 2 weeks, customer service was good and fair. I did purchase another corsair cooling device.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Naas

customer_reviews.title: but so far I love it. Running a mild OC on my 4690k ...
customer_reviews.text: Only been running this for a couple days, but so far I love it. Running a mild OC on my 4690k (4.3Ghz @ 1.24v currently, been up to 4.5, but voltage is a bit too high for my tastes) and it keeps it in check with torture test temps ~70C. I will say one thing, though - the pre-applied thermal compound was good for 75C with the same settings. 70C is on Arctic Silver, but your results may vary! You do need access to the back of your motherboard to install the backing plate, but once that's done, installation is a breeze. Looks good, is very quiet, cools well, what more can you ask for? Also, no leaks. :D
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Pratt

product_meta.title: CORSAIR Hydro Series H115i AIO Liquid CPU Cooler, 280mm Radiator, Dual 140mm SP Series PWM Fans, Advanced RGB Lighting and Fan Software Control
product_meta.description: Style:H115i RGBHydro Series H115i is an all-in-one liquid CPU cooler with a 280mmradiator and dual SP140L PWM fans for cooling that's far superior to stock CPU air coolers. Liquid cooling works better than air cooling, and the self contained design of the H115i gets you up and running quickly so you can spend more time enjoying the performance of your overclocked processor and less time assembling, filling, and maintaining your cooling system. The H115i has Corsair Link software control built in. Just attach the included cable to a USB header on your motherboard and download the software from Corsair.com, then customize and monitor your temps, fan and pump speeds, and even the RGB LED logo on the cold plate. Customer Service/QA /Technical Assistance Team: customer service/tech support: 1-888-222-4346 opt. 1
feature_bullets: Improved coldplate and pump design: better efficiency gives you lower temperatures with less noise
Advanced SP140L PWM fan design: better high-static pressure air delivery and customizable speed ; Radiator dimensions: 140 x 312 x 26 millimeter
Compatibility : AMD sockets FM1, FM2, AM2, AM3, AM4

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,808 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
